directory.description: Path of the input and output abstract syntax tree directory. By default, the directory will be used to write a `.json` file for each target platform's abstract syntax tree that has been extracted. By default, the same abstract syntax tree `.json` files will then be read when generating C# code.

output_file_directory.description: Path of the output abstract syntax tree directory. The directory will contain one or more generated abstract syntax tree `.json` files which each have a file name of the target platform.

input_file.description: Path of the input `.h` header file containing C code.

items.description: The directories to search for non-system header files.

user_include_directories.description: The directories to search for non-system header files.

items.description: The directories to search for system header files.

system_include_directories.description: The directories to search for system header files.

items.description: The C function names to explicitly include when parsing C code. Default is `null`. If `null`, all functions found may be included. Note that C function names which are excluded may also exclude any transitive types.

functions_allowed.description: The C function names to explicitly include when parsing C code. Default is `null`. If `null`, all functions found may be included. Note that C function names which are excluded may also exclude any transitive types.

items.description: Type names that may be found when parsing C code that will be interpreted as opaque types. Opaque types are often used with a pointer to hide the information about the bit layout behind the pointer.

opaque_types.description: Type names that may be found when parsing C code that will be interpreted as opaque types. Opaque types are often used with a pointer to hide the information about the bit layout behind the pointer.

is_enabled_location_full_paths.description: Determines whether to show the the path of header code locations with full paths or relative paths. Use `true` to use the full path for header locations. Use `false` or omit this property to show only relative file paths.

is_enabled_macro_objects.description: Determines whether to include or exclude macro objects. Use `true` or omit this property to include macro objects. Use `false` to exclude macro objects.

is_enabled_functions.description: Determines whether to include or exclude functions. Use `true` or omit this property to include functions. Use `false` to exclude functions.

is_enabled_variables.description: Determines whether to include or exclude variables. Use `true` or omit this property to include variables. Use `false` to exclude variables.

is_enabled_enums_dangling.description: Determines whether to include or exclude enums that are transitive to a function or variable. Use `true` to include dangling enums. Use `false` or omit this property to exclude dangling enums.

is_enabled_allow_names_with_prefixed_und.description: Determines whether to include or exclude functions, enums, structs, typedefs, etc with a prefixed underscore; such declarations are sometimes considered 'non public'. Use `true` to include declarations with a prefixed underscore. Use `false` or omit this property to exclude declarations with a prefixed underscore.

is_enabled_system_declarations.description: Determines whether to include or exclude system declarations. Use `true` to include system functions, enums, typedefs, records, etc. Use `false` or omit this property to exclude system declarations.

is_enabled_find_target_platform_system_h.description: Determines whether to automatically find and append the system headers for the target platform. Use `true` or omit this property to automatically find and append system headers for the target platform. Use `false` to not find and append system headers for the target platform.

items.description: The directories to search for non-system header files specific to the target platform.

user_include_directories.description: The directories to search for non-system header files specific to the target platform.

items.description: The directories to search for system header files of the target platform.

system_include_directories.description: The directories to search for system header files of the target platform.

items.description: Object-like macros to use when parsing C code.

defines.description: Object-like macros to use when parsing C code.

items.description: C header file paths to exclude. File paths are relative to the `IncludeDirectories` property.

header_files_blocked.description: C header file paths to exclude. File paths are relative to the `IncludeDirectories` property.

items.description: Additional Clang arguments to use when parsing C code.

clang_arguments.description: Additional Clang arguments to use when parsing C code.

additionalProperties.description: The target platform configurations for extracting the abstract syntax trees. Each target platform is a Clang target triple. See the C2CS docs for more details about what target platforms are available.

platforms.description: The target platform configurations for extracting the abstract syntax trees. Each target platform is a Clang target triple. See the C2CS docs for more details about what target platforms are available.

ast.description: The configuration for reading the `.h` C header file.

output_file.description: Path of the output C# `.cs` file.

library_name.description: The name of the dynamic link library (without the file extension) used for platform invoke (P/Invoke) with C#. If not specified, the library name is the same as the name of the `OutputFilePath` property without the directory name and without the file extension.

namespace_name.description: The name of the namespace to be used for the C# static class. If not specified, the namespace is the same as the `LibraryName` property.

class_name.description: The name of the C# static class. If not specified, the class name is the same as the `LibraryName` property.

region_header_file.description: Path of the text file which to add the file's contents to the top of the C# file. Useful for comments, extra namespace using statements, or additional code that needs to be added to the generated C# file.

region_footer_file.description: Path of the text file which to add the file's contents to the bottom of the C# file. Useful for comments or additional code that needs to be added to the generated C# file.

items.description: Pairs of strings for re-mapping type names. Each pair has source name and a target name. Does not change the bit layout of types.

mapped.description: Pairs of strings for re-mapping type names. Each pair has source name and a target name. Does not change the bit layout of types.

items.description: Names of types, functions, enums, constants, or anything else that may be found when parsing C code that will be ignored when generating C# code. Type names are ignored after mapping type names using `MappedTypeNames` property.

ignored.description: Names of types, functions, enums, constants, or anything else that may be found when parsing C code that will be ignored when generating C# code. Type names are ignored after mapping type names using `MappedTypeNames` property.

cs.description: The configuration for writing the `.cs` C# source code file.

items.description: Names of libraries and/or interfaces for macOS, iOS, tvOS or watchOS.

Nullable\u00601.description: Names of libraries and/or interfaces for macOS, iOS, tvOS or watchOS.
